Reviews.Title: Apple iPhone 4S, Does it Live up to the Hype?
Reviews.Author: The Gifted One
Reviews.Content: I entered the smartphone world back in 2008 staring with the Apple iPhone 3G.  Coming over from my old Sprint flip-phone, the iPhone 3G was a major upgrade and blew my mind with how much it could do.  It was amazing that cell phones had advanced into a sort of mini-PC.Fast forward to the present-day and I have now used and experimented with various smartphones, different cellphone companies, and smartphones OS's (iOS, Android, Windows, etc).  I also run my own small cell phone shop and get to play with these devices on a daily basis.  Back in the iPhone 3G days, there were only a few smartphone options to choose from.  Today there are literally hundreds of devices across several carriers.  All with different functions and designs.  I'm going to cover how the iPhone 4S stacks up to the competition, what the competition is, what the 4S can do, and what improvements it makes over its predecessor, the iPhone 4.HARDWAREThe iPhone 4S is almost identical in hardware design to the iPhone 4.  It features the same rectangular shape with the flat gorilla glass back and front screen.  The front and rear camera are in the same position.  The only visible difference on the outside of the phone is that the volume controls are slightly moved on the 4S.  The real difference in the hardware is on the inside.  The iPhone 4S uses a dual-core "A5" processor.  This makes it significantly faster than the iPhone 4.  The processor is the raw power that apps need in order to operate fast and fluidly without slowdown or hiccups.  With basic use, users probably won't notice much difference from the iPhone 4's speed.  The extra power boost mainly shows its worth when playing some of the more high-end iOS games and apps.CAMERAIn addition to the new processor, the iPhone 4S has an improved 8 megapixel camera.  It also now has the ability to capture full 1080p HD Video.  Unless you're a professional photographer, you will be blown away with how great the 4S is at taking pictures.  It is on par with most of the dedicated point-and-shoot cameras that are currently on the market.  Images are clear, crisp, and very colorful.  I even sold my 10MP Canon point-and-shoot after using the 4S for a few weeks.  When comparing pictures taken with the iPhone 4 side by side to the 4S, the difference is like night and day.  As for the 1080P videos, they're also very beautiful.  Just like the photos, the videos rival dedicated point-and-shoot devices and look absolutely gorgeous on the iPhone's retina display screen.  The only drawback to these 1080p videos is that they can take up large amounts of memory.  So if you plan on shooting a large amount of video, you may need to consider getting the 32GB or 64GB iPhone 4S.SIGNAL RECEPTION AND DATA SPEEDSThe iPhone 4S has been expanded to include a 3rd US carrier Sprint.  This brings your total choices to Verizon, AT&T;, and Sprint.Signal reception and data speeds will vary by carrier and location, so I'll give you some basic information about what to expect on average.  Signal reception is greatly improved compared to the iPhone 4.  The antenna problem from the iPhone 4 has been removed and the 4S uses separate antennas for incoming and outgoing calls in order to increase overall reception. AT&T; is a GSM carrier while Sprint and Verizon are CDMA carriers.  Verizon has the overall largest and most expansive voice coverage of the three, closely followed by AT&T;, with Sprint in third.  The 4S Data speeds will largely vary by carrier and location.  Being a GSM carrier, AT&T; is the only iPhone carrier capable of using the 4S's improved HSPA+ data speeds.  AT&T; users will notice their iPhones showing "4G" in the top left corner rather than 3G.  Though this is faster than standard 3G, do not confuse it with the much faster 4G LTE network.  The iPhone 4S is not yet capable of using that network.  Verizon is second in 3G data speeds, with Sprint bringing up the rear.  Again, these are average speeds from across the nation.  Individual results may vary depending on your location.  It is also important to note that Sprint is the only carrier that still offers unlimited data.  This may be an important factor in choosing a carrier for some.BATTERY LIFEiPhone owners have come to expect excellent battery life from their devices.  Previous iPhones have ranked among the most impressive in terms of battery life compared to rival Android devices.  In the past each new iteration of the iPhone had better battery life than the previous device.  With the 4S however, the overall battery life is about the same as the iPhone 4.  Apple claims this is mainly because of the dual-core processor used by the 4S as well as the more demanding iOS 5 software that is included with the iPhone 4S.  Due to this, there were some widespread complaints about the iPhone 4S battery life initially.  Apple has since addressed the issue with their iOS 5.1 update.  The iPhone 4S now ranks among the top smartphones in overall battery life.  I can easily get through a full day on one full charge of average use.SOFTWAREUsually when comparing the iPhone to other phones, it comes down to the software.  There is a big ongoing debate among techies between the iPhone's operating system "iOS" and Google's "Android" operating system.  It's comparable to the famous PC vs Mac debate.  Rather than type a whole page comparing the two, I'll just cover a few basics.  The main difference between the two is choice.  Customize or not customize.  iOS is more fluid and crisp out of the box.  All iPhones/iPods/iPads use this standard OS.  Less powerful iOS devices are often able to move as fast or faster than more powerful Android counterparts.  However, major modifications and customizations of Apple's iOS are not possible.  The standard 4x4 row of icons is what you will get.  Android offers tons of customization options.  This is great for advanced tech users, but can be overwhelming to novice smartphone users or those not really interested in editing and customizing a lot to get the device to do what they need it to do.  I usually recommend iOS to customers new to smartphones due to its more simple and easy to use interface.  If you like customizing and making your the software on your phone look different from everyone else, I recommend an Android device.The other major software difference between iOS and Android is the Apps.  The Apple app store still has by far the most support and overall apps from developers.  Most developers create an app for the iPhone first and port it later on to Android, or sometimes not at all.  From personal experiences with both, I can say that many times the iPhone version of an app usually runs better or has more features.SIRI Personal AssistantUnless you've been under a rock for the past few months, you've heard of the iPhone 4S's SIRI personal assistant software.  Apple touts it as a feature that allows you to speak voice commands to your iPhone and SIRI will do whatever you ask it to do.  Well it can do some things, but not quite everything.  SIRI is great for finding places for you.  You can say simple things like "I'm hungry" and SIRI will open the Maps App and show you the location of all restaurants in the nearby area.  You can also do things like tell it to play a certain song or artist from the music stored on your iPhone or ask it the Weather forecast for any given day.  SIRI can also be pretty entertaining when asked random conversational questions.  Questions such as "How old are you?" will cause SIRI to respond "Does this concern you?", "I didn't think so".  Or saying silly things such as "SIRI I love you" will cause it to say "I'll bet you say that to all your Apple products".  Overall it's a pretty nice added feature, but not a major selling point at this time.  It's limitation is that it currently is only integrated with the standard apps that Apple provides on the iPhone.  Once it is integrated with more of the third-part apps, I can see it becoming a seriously useful feature.Overall I would definitely recommend the iPhone 4S.  From the sleek hardware design, the beautiful camera, and the very large Apple App store, it's my top phone at the moment.  The iPhone 4S has the battery life to last most people a full day and in terms of overall speed and ease of use, it is currently among the best available.  The only people who I would not recommend the 4S to are current iPhone 4 owners.  With all of the iPhone 4S's improvements, I don't feel like they're significant enough to spend more money to upgrade from your iPhone 4.  You will be better off waiting for whatever iPhone Apple releases later this year.  However if you're looking to purchase your first smartphone, tired of your old Blackberry or Android device, or just have an older iPhone 3GS or 3G, I would strongly recommend getting the iPhone 4S if possible.  Using a smartphone has never been easier.

Reviews.Title: It is Locket AT&T;
Reviews.Author: Judd
Reviews.Content: I brought this phone in december, when i realized there might a confusion between locked to AT&T; or Factory Unlocked. I contacted the provider and they did say it is locked to AT&T;, at that time the phone was selling for $ 649. Despite I sent it with package unopened, they cut off $30.00 on the refund, I really disappointed. Please note I paid for both shippings (sent and returned).If you need a factory unlocked Iphone 4S, you bette not buy this one IT IS LOCKED TO AT&T.;

Reviews.Title: The Truth about these locked phones
Reviews.Author: A Gentleman
Reviews.Content: Buying directly from Appleor an Apple retail store (NOT Best Buy or anywhere else) is the ONLY way to get an unlocked iphone, and even then, it will only work with at&t; or T-Mobile (GSM networks only).If you buy one from anywhere else, regardless of what you are told, you will be getting a phone that is locked to a single network, and there's nothing you can do to fix it. Verizon may work with you under certain terms, but that's if you're lucky.When they say "unlocked," they mean "partially unlocked" so that you can use non-US (i.e., foreign) SIM cards in the phone if you travel. When you're in the US, you are locked to the network of the mobile service provider that sold you the phone.Go to the apple website to buy one contract free, and you will see this information provided at the bottom of the page.

Reviews.Title: The iPhone 4S: a smartphone and a whole lot more
Reviews.Author: SophieK
Reviews.Content: I finally made the transition to the Apple iPhone 4S after over two years of a few highs and countless lows with an old Motorola Droid (model A855), which now serves as a paper weight.  I'll make this short and sweet.What I love:1. The awesome camera, especially when paired with the Camera+ app, allows me to keep my bulky DSLR at home when I need a good, serviceable scenery shot for social media posts.2. How much nicer the apps are compared to those on the Android platform.  The iPhone apps run smoother and are much nicer to look at.3. The size is perfect.  It fits with ease in my hands as well as my pockets.  It feels natural when I hold it - probably explains why a klutz like me hasn't dropped it yet (knock on wood).4. Siri is a reliable personal assistant for very basic tasks.  I regularly ask her to set my alarm and she has yet to let me down.  No important dates/meetings missed yet!  I can't wait to see what else she can do.What could be better:1. The price could be lower.  I bought mine unsubsidized for $649+ through Virgin Mobile to avoid the ridiculous two-year commitment Verizon wanted from me.Overall, I have no regrets moving to the iPhone 4S, a beautiful, intuitive, well-designed mobile device destined to become a modern museum piece.

Reviews.Title: Fragile Intelligence
Reviews.Author: redmondsODU
Reviews.Content: I purchased the iPhone 4S last November with my hard earned McDonald's paychecks. I was ecstatic to open the box of the most raved about smartphone of this generation. Not only is the iPhone a great phone, but it has become a status symbol of our time.After a year with the iPhone, I can still say I love it (which is unusual with cellphones I've had in the past, they're usually having a glitch of some kind after a year or less of use)! It has all of the wonders of a generic cell phone: text messaging (with the added fun of emoticons), calling (including FaceTime, exclusive to Apple products), calendar, alerts, and now social networking. When I first powered up my iPhone, I was surprised to find the "Twitter" app already installed, because apple is partnered with Twitter, their built-in app is AMAZING! The Apple app store is another bonus of having the iPhone. You can find any and every app from Apple's app store. I also love the simplicity of the iPhone, with one simple button on the face, a lock button on top, and volume buttons on the side, it's not too hard to figure out. I can go on forever about how amazing the iPhone is, because it hasn't let me down yet.Apple does, however, fail me in one aspect of the iPhone. The phone is made of glass. The fragility of the phone makes it like a prized possession that must be handled carefully, any wrong drop at the wrong angle can shatter your screen and break your heart in an instant. I know this personally because I've recently shattered my iPhone screen... I cried.Join Team iPhone, you won't regret it.

I BOUGHT IT TO AN APPLE STORE TO FIND OUT THAT IT WAS NOT A NEW PHONE!!!!  THE PHONE WAS BOUGHT ON OC 2011, THE BACKPLATE AND PARTS WERE FAKE, AND THE BATTERY WAS WORN FOR BEING USED!!!!!!  FOR MORE THAN 2 YEARS.  APPLE DOES NOT WANT TO TOUCH IT OR MAKE CHANGES BECUASE IT IS NOT AN ORIGINAL PHONE FROM THEM!!!FIRST REACTION FROM BOTH SELLERS WAS TO TELL ME THAT THE PHONE WAS OUT OF WARRANTY. THEY DO NOT SEEM TO UNDERSTAND THAT IT IS NOT THE BATTERY I AM COMPLAINING ABOUT.  I HAVE BEEN RIPPED OFF COMPLETELY. THIS IS FRAUD. THEY HAVE SOLD ME SOMETHING ORIGINAL AND NEW PAID 500 DOLLARS AND 8 MONTHS LATER IT TURNS OUT THAT IT IS A FAKE AND USED PHONE . AND NO NONE IS RESPONSIBLE. CELL LOUNGE THE SELLER  OF COURSE DOES NOT WANT TO TAKE RESPONSIBILITY BECAUSE THEY CLAIM THAT THEY BOUGHT IT NEW AND HOLD IT FOR 2 YEARS BEFORE SELLING IT!!!!CURRENTLY I AM IN A FIGHT WITH THE SELLER WHO THINKS I AM STUPID AND SHOULD EAT UP THEIR SCAM!!  AND TAKE THEIR APOLOGIES  AND THROW AWAY THE PHONE AND BUY A NEW ONE.I HAVE CALLED 1000 TIME TO AMAZON CUSTOMER SERVICE, FILED A COMPLAINT, BUT GET NO ANSWER FROM THEM.HOPEFULLY WITH THIS REVIEW A HUMAN BEING WILL DECIDE TO CONTACT ME!I AM EXTREMELY DISAPPOINTED WITH AMAZON AND THEY WAY THIS IS BEING HANDLED.

Reviews.Title: A killer device that's far from obsolete
Reviews.Author: Tony L.
Reviews.Content: I purchased my first iPhone 4s in February 2012. Now that you can get the iPhone 4 for free with a two-year contract, it's worth giving this little workhorse another look.Only two years ago, this phone had the fastest processor on any smart device. While the competition ( including three new iPhones from Apple) have better overall specs, the 4s is no slouch. Performance is still snappy even running Apple's latest version of iOS 7. Frame rates are consistently smooth when swiping between home pages and opening apps. And first party apps like Siri and Maps run without a hitch.Next to the competition, the screen on the 4s seems to get smaller everyday, but the quality of that screen, in terms of dots per inch and color reproduction, hasn't given up much ground. The same goes for the camera, which arguably produces better results than flagship phones such as the HTC One, and can still easily replace most point-and-shoot cameras.And for most people, the reason why they buy a phone is to make calls. To that end, the iPhone 4s does not disappoint. Calls are crisp. Simple, but often overlooked tasks, such as visual voicemail, or copy and paste between contacts, text messages, and dialer functions is taken for granted by iOS users, but still refreshing for Android users, where these features feel much more half-baked.The biggest and most obvious feature you'll miss out on with the 4s is the screen size. While it works great for basic tasks such as making calls, looking up directions, or playing music, it's not nearly as comfortable as a go-to device for browsing the web, reading books, or watching video.That said, the iPhone 4s is still a world class-device that shouldn't be overlooked. At just over two years old (and despite what marketers would have you believe), it does a fantastic job doing the things you need it to do, like taking calls, snapping pictures, and delivering on the promise to put the Internet in your pocket. What's more, you can get it for free, which makes a compelling case for which phone gives you the most bang for your buck.

Reviews.Title: Best Phone I have ever Owned
Reviews.Author: R. Milliken "Rev Ralph"
Reviews.Content: This is the third smartphone I have owned, and the first one I have genuinely loved. From the first moment to now I love this phone. This is rare for me. The first smartphone I owned was the Palm Pixi, and it did not live up to the hype. It was fragile (not to say that the iPhone isn't, because by all means it is very fragile), came apart easily, and after less than 6 months, it was rendered almost unusable. When it came time for an update, I decided that even though my family would be taking the iPhone route, I was not an Apple Fanboy, and I would give Android a try. I got what was supposed to be the best smartphone "in the world", but ended up being a mistake, the Motorola Atrix. It worked well, there is no denying, but the screen was plasticky and almost couldn't be used without the constant turn off, and turn back on, to make sure that no random contact would get a text from me that would read: hfdhafjkadjkfaj;sdfjasdfjd  djfakldfjadjklfasd. Not to mention the battery life was not the greatest, it took forever to charge, and the phone itself took a long time to learn. Suffice it to say that after one long year with the phone I decided I would go against all my ethics, slip out of my contract, and spend an arm and a leg for a cellphone that I was not even sure if I would like. I was by no means an Apple Fanboy, but I had high hopes for this phone, and it has surpassed them and more. It is fast, it is built well, it is a seamless learning process to get used to it, the messaging app is crisp and clean, the visual voice mail and the calling app in general are great, there are tons of well designed apps, the screen is crystal clear, the music application far surpasses most Android phones (including my old cellphone), and it has a reputation of high-quality, long lasting products to back it. Yes, it is expensive, but it is very worth it. If you want a phone that feels well built, and solid, and will perform well, I assure you that this one does not disappoint.

Reviews.Title: never buy from this seller again!!!
Reviews.Author: Ily
Reviews.Content: i usually don't leave bad reviews but this time i feel very frustated! it has been almost a month since i retuned my defective iphone, first of all the iphone i ordered said it was for AT&T; (that's why i but it). when it arrived it did not turn on so i thought i needed to be charged but it never turned on. when i was ready to pack it and ship it, it finally turned on but it was a verizon iphone not AT&T; as listed. then it suddently started turning on and off by itself so i finally shipped it back. since then i've been contacting the seller for my refund and all i got was "i will refund your money asap" but i don't know what asap means for them becasue i haven't received it in about a month.i will not recomend this seller to anyone!!

Reviews.Title: Love it!
Reviews.Author: Amazon Customer
Reviews.Content: The phone came right away when it was ordered. I have has this phone for months, and since then I have had no issues at all and I love it. Thanks so much!

Reviews.Title: DO NOT BUY FROM THEM
Reviews.Author: ATSUKO RICHARDSON
Reviews.Content: DO NOT BUY from them!!! The one I bought from them didn't even take SIM card. I took it to repair place and they said it was water damaged and screws were missing and could not believe they even put that for a sale. One month return policy is horrible too. Just they are horrible!!! It was $300 for a piece of brick. Sorry amazon , u should consider do something about them

Reviews.Title: DO NOT BUY FROM BUYMART. THEY SELL TAMPERED PRODUCT AS "NEW"
Reviews.Author: sunil
Reviews.Content: Hello Friends,I am writing this review after tons of emails with Buymart and Amazon. Summary is that BuyMart is fraud and they sell tampered products as "New" instead of "Refurbished".I purchased Iphone 3G as Birthday gift for my wife on Dec 2012 and the phone's home button stopped working on Dec 2013 and there were few more days left to complete the 1 Year. Though Buymart and Amazon gives replacement only within like 3 months, I was expecting Manufacturer warrenty of 1 year from Apple.To my surprise Apple said the warranty expired as this product was purchased in Sep 2009! The most surprising thing is that They said lots of parts in this phone has been replaced and tampered with. This was surprise to me since I payed almost 300 bucks to get this phone in "New" condition!I Don't see an option to attach a file else I would have  uploaded the diagnosis results from Apple Store here. But these are the highlights from Apple diagnosis notes. I have decided to file lawsuit against amazon and Buymart as both are doing fraud- Upon Visual inspection Unit appears to have third party modification- Unit was purchased in 2009 and taken to a third party location to have repairs- Unit receiver and Speaker is third party- Back module is third party- Unit was sold as "like new" however there is evidence of third party repair- Service denied due to unauthorized modificationSo think before you decide to buyThanks,Sunil

Reviews.Title: I am very disappointed
Reviews.Author: changping wang
Reviews.Content: Charger is bad.back Cover is not original, Battery charging 300 times, I am very disappointed,If I'm not in China,I must return

Reviews.Title: Great
Reviews.Author: Adam
Reviews.Content: The specifications were all correct and this phone has not given me any problems. Can't say anything bad about it.

Reviews.Title: Bummed out over this order
Reviews.Author: Mr. M
Reviews.Content: The phone came in its own box wrapped with thin plastic with no protection.  It was not insured. The phone did not appear to be new. There was no tool to open the sim card container.  The phone was defective and could not take pictures with the front camera.. only the selfie camera worked.  The volume could not be adjusted.  I returned the phone to the vendor, insured and wrapped in a box with protection ($21.00) and I am still waiting on my refund from the vendor. It the meantime, I have ordered another phone, a black iPhone directly from Amazon Prime and it is wonderful. Had to file and A-Z claim.

Reviews.Title: Solid Phone, even in 2013, which is 2 years from birth!
Reviews.Author: Kevin AcelaExpress
Reviews.Content: I personally have an intermediate/advanced amatuer kind of knowledge so I am not an expert expert if you will so this review will be based as is. In addition, this review is not baased on a purchase thru Amazon.com.Usage:I have had this model of phone (Apple iPhone 4S 16GB White) since September of 2012. I have had it replaced in April of 2013 due to a mix of personal and manufacturer issues. I have also had that replacement replaced in November of 2013 due to manufacturer issues. However, I still have to say, because of the Genius Bar and overall Warrenty (AppleCare+) experiences, it's a key part of this device's goods. Plus, if I am not a power-user, I don't have to replace it! In addition, for a long term feel, I think Battery Life could see improvements, even the newest could see some more improvements because the sub 2000-mAh battery is not enough for real world usage. I'm down to 50% before mid-day even passed so it's not a device for the power-user like me.Connectivity:I have to say, there is indeed still somewhat of antenna issues but it's not as bad as it can be, which means it's comparable in performance with most comparable smartphones out there. However, I would say this, this device can perform better than comparable devices, simply due to the communication technology algorithms, especially since I can have a HD video load smoothly in real time without any issues when not throttled on "4G - 3G". I would also note that Wi-Fi and Bluetooth are solid when you are on iOS 6.1 or higher, however if you do not want iOS 7 taking up storage (assuming your current device doesn't have it) don't turn on Wi-Fi or your device will have up to 3GB's lost depending.Audio/Video:The iPhone is pretty much well know to have an amazing screen and audio preformance, however I just wish the device has a slightly larger screen, and a slighty better speaker so I can see and hear much better, but I would be more scathing if this device is released in 2013 as in 2011/2012 only the smaller devices had better performance. I would indeed say this, the color accuracy is great, the screen is sharp and everything look great, especially high-quality photos. Music listening is also great even so the speaker could see more improvements, still it's probably the best speaker on a Smartphone in 2011-2012 years, perhaps even in 2013 from iOS to Android to Windows Phone to Blackberry. The iPhone 4S is just solid still, even 2+ years later!Camera:Coming from Feature Phones and owning a 3GS and iPad 2 for a little over a year when I upgraded in 2012, I have to say the Camera is amazing, it's a dramatic upgrade. Even so there are better cameraphones out there like the Lumia 92x/102x series, Samsung Galaxy S4/N3 and iPhone 5S, the 4S still can deliver in 2013, and for the greater part of 2014. So you'll have a solid device for at least 50% of your contract if you buy before New Years 2013-2014 so it's an amazing device to own still. The 8 MegaPixels deliver sharp images, comparable to a Canon upper range Point & Shoot, though I wouldn't put it comparable to DSLR as Apple puts it since it doesn't deliver RAW as DSLR's deliver RAW.Overall: Overall rating is 4/5 stars as of November 2013, so I would highly recommend it, especially if you are comparing it to the 5/5C since the 4S is good enough if not, a tad bit more solid oddly.

Reviews.Title: User friendly, my mom can use it!
Reviews.Author: Tamara
Reviews.Content: I've had my 4s now for 2 years and it's still in great condition, never crashes and with the iOS 7 update, feels like a brand new phone! I definitely recommend the 4s to anyone that is looking for a user friendly device and still actually want to make calls on their phone. Not a phone I would recommend to people who want the latest and greatest or want more customizable options.

Reviews.Title: Couldn't be happier!
Reviews.Author: D. M. Atkinson
Reviews.Content: This refurbished iPhone 4S was delivered in new condition in less time than the supplier promised. It was configured in the basic format and took me less than an hour to get in service with my carrier (Consumer Cellular). It has been working flawlessly since!

Reviews.Title: Refurbished is the way to go!
Reviews.Author: L. Craig
Reviews.Content: I have never had a cell phone and I am a penny pincher, so I wanted to buy my own phone, and then find a month to month service.  I considered buying a new phone, a used phone, and a refurbished phone.  I asked the seller (Green Grape) a bunch of questions about refurbished phones and they had good answers for all of my questions.  I had already decided on an IPhone 4S, and they had a very reasonably priced, refurbished, white phone.I now have my IPhone and I just could not be happier about the phone and the company I chose to buy it from on Amazon.  First of all, the phone looks brand new and it works like a brand new phone.  It came in an original box with all of the accessories.  My wife has showed me how to get everything going and the phone is just in excellent condition.  I am very pleased.

Reviews.Title: I would not do it again through Amazon
Reviews.Author: Daniel Khouri
Reviews.Content: the phone came with many problems, the WiFi signal is always weak. the reception is poor, there is a penetration of humidity (as per the indicator within the headphone jack)... I would not do it again through Amazon.

Reviews.Title: Best upgrade
Reviews.Author: moranm082
Reviews.Content: Prior to upgrading myself to the iPhone 4S I was dealing with the variety of "basic" phones that providers offer. I was constantly having difficulties with operating and the mechanics of those phones, therefore figured that upgrading to my first smartphone was truly the best option. As a college student I am always on the go, however need to stay in contact with certain aspects of my life such as checking and sending emails, keeping up with social media, etc. The iPhone 4S truly does make this easy to accomplish with minimal problems or issues. The phone is easy to operate once you get the hang of it, much like any new and unfamiliar device. I was impressed with how simple the layout is of the phone itself also. I use this phone for basically all of my day-to-day activities, and this phone only makes completing these easier. I feel as though everything I could need for my lifestyle currently is at my fingertips with the iPhone 4S. One of the only negatives that I have for this phone is that it is extremely fragile. Many of my friends keep a cheap, plastic case on their phone where it could easily break after one fall. I recommend something more durable for keeping your phone safe since the screen is the largest and only component on this phone. I also thought that I would have more issues with texting on my phone seeing as I have been used to actually pressing buttons and not just typing on a virtual keyboard, however texting and typing on this phone was simple and easy to pick up. I recommend this phone to any person who is looking for something that can ease their day-to-day schedule and life's hassles.

Reviews.Title: Good condition
Reviews.Author: Harlan
Reviews.Content: It looked brand new and was in the original box.  No complaints, just wish it cost less.  No scratches. The phone had been reset to original factory settings.

Reviews.Title: like new iphone
Reviews.Author: alex
Reviews.Content: when i got my package is was nicely packaged.I had no issues what so ever. the iphone itself was in a like new condition, which i wonder if the user ever used before, that how much the iPhone was in great shape. no complaints what so ever!

Reviews.Title: I like it
Reviews.Author: yunyoung nam
Reviews.Content: Very fast shipping.It is almost brand new.But, there is no earphone.BTW, I recommend this item.Looks like a new one

Reviews.Title: I love it!
Reviews.Author: sda
Reviews.Content: i order the used iphone from the amazon warehouse about a month ago and i was shocked on how good the condition of the phone was. it only have a little scratch on the screen but other than that it was like new! i'm very happy about my purchase!

Reviews.Title: couldnt even tell it was used
Reviews.Author: Tiffany
Reviews.Content: for the price i paid, i feel as though it was worth it. the brightness acts a bit funny at times but besides that, it was a wonderful replacement for my 8GB iphone 4 w/ the cracked screen.

Reviews.Title: Great!!!
Reviews.Author: Roert McComic
Reviews.Content: This is a great phone I love it.  Just like a hand held computer with everything in between.  Great buy.

Reviews.Title: Great phone!
Reviews.Author: EvaBalo
Reviews.Content: Apple has a fantastic reputation, and rightfully so. All their products are extremely reliable and durable! I got my iPhone 4S for a great price with all the original cords, it looks unused. While buying make sure that you're buying the exact model you want (unlocked, GSM, etc). I would recommend this to anyone as long as they're sure they're getting exactly what they wanted

Reviews.Title: GREAT.....
Reviews.Author: iluv2workout8
Reviews.Content: The iPhone 4s in must thought is Apples BEST iPhone even over the iPhone 5. Would recommend this phone to all!

Reviews.Title: Simple one word Awesome
Reviews.Author: Sushant
Reviews.Content: Simply Superb :) The cameera,apps and features are really good and liked it. I was using other brand phone but after this really its amazing with superb quality. Nice experience.

Reviews.Title: excellent
Reviews.Author: ju pan
Reviews.Content: The phone I purchased is in perfect condotion, I like it very much! love it , love it , love it...

Reviews.Title: Great product
Reviews.Author: Nico
Reviews.Content: The phone worked just fine and I love it. The best part I think is the vast amount of apps that you can install to the phone. The only thing I worry about is dropping the phone, screen looks like it could not take a beating.

Reviews.Title: I LOVE IT
Reviews.Author: Sandro Trejo Bracho
Reviews.Content: Until now this has been the best purchase I have made because the phone greatly exceeded my expectations. I want the brand continues, and it rests in innovate and offer a fair price the best phone.

Reviews.Title: Solid Build, Great Applications
Reviews.Author: S. C. Krystek "Synthetic Human"
Reviews.Content: I went through 3 Android phones in less than two years before finally spending the extra money to get an iPhone. The main reason: everyone I talked to who owned an iPhone already had been using the same phone for 2 years or more. When you combine the costs of all the Android phones I had purchased in the same amount of time, I spent around $900 on phones, so the extra cost in an Apple product is justified when you take into account how long they are built to last.The phone is extremely simple to use, the range of apps available make it easy to customize your phone, and it syncs with my iMac perfectly (something I had severe problems with on the Android phones).While this isn't the latest, greatest model of the iPhone, it is still a massive upgrade in phone quality compared to what I was used to.

Reviews.Title: Great phone
Reviews.Author: Amazon Addict
Reviews.Content: I decided to purchase this instead of the Iphone 5, mainly due to the price difference. I also wasn't sold on the "benefits" of the new iphone5. Personally this phone does everything I need and more. The interface is responsive, Siri is cool, and wifi and internet work flawlessly. Most importantly the "phone" aspect of the iphone works good as well. Another feature that was highly important to me was the availability of a wide variety of apps. You can't be an iphone in that respect! Highly recommend over almost any other smartphone out there.

Reviews.Title: An iPhone make the 'so called' smart phone look dumb!
Reviews.Author: Pandoras' Box
Reviews.Content: I love my iPhone 4S.  Apple is the best.  They make an ordinary smartphone look dumb.  Even the iPhone 4 are nice.  I will NEVER go back to a smartphone.  Smartphones are very limited.  iPhones are much better than droids and any other phones that are out there.  The only downfall is the battery.  It does not last long enough without being charged; but on the outside of that it wonderful. I LOVE FaceTime that the iPhone and iPad has on them.  FaceTime connect you with your loved ones and anyone else you would like to see providing they too have an iphone or ipad. If you want to keep in touch and actually see your loved ones, don't just purchase yourself one, purchase another for a loved one like I did. I would recommend this to everyone.  Get rid of your 'so called' smart phone and move up to an iPhone!

Reviews.Title: I love it
Reviews.Author: coolmama
Reviews.Content: I got this for my Birthday gift and I fell in love. I don't want what I'm going to do without them. I love all the free apps you can download. I love the user interface, and I love the camera! Picture quality is nice.

Reviews.Title: Battery won't hold a charge longer than a day
Reviews.Author: John D. Taylor "jtsurf"
Reviews.Content: I paid a lotta money for a phone that doesn't work well and needs rebooting frequently. Can't get access to Mail or Voicemail depending on where I am.  Very disappointed, camera isn't that hot either.

Reviews.Title: Apple iPhone
Reviews.Author: Qua22
Reviews.Content: I was really satisfied with my purchase. I love my phone. The phone was in good condition and had no scratches. The only thing I wasn't satisfied about was that it was a locked phone and that I had a lot to go through to get it unlocked.

Reviews.Title: Don't bother, since Apple burned 4S owners
Reviews.Author: J. D. Riche "Dost"
Reviews.Content: It's pretty simple - unless you want to run the old version of IOS and have Apps pass you by, you'll upgrade to IOS7, rendering your iPhone 4S WORTHLESSLY SLOW and feeble - when it will run at all.  My husband, people at the office - everybody says the same thing - Apple totally screwed us on the upgrade, forcing an upgrade to the 5C or 5S.  Your choices are a new $700 phone from Apple or being spyed on by Google's Android.  Windows is barely worth mentioning, unless you want an inch thick phone with what is presumably a buggy Windows device.  Great options these days, eh?

Reviews.Title: it works, but...
Reviews.Author: Denise Lopez
Reviews.Content: The phone works fine and the seller shipped it very fast, but left out a big detail in the product discription. There is some kind of yellow spot inside the glass/LCD of the screen. It doesn't prevent the phone from working correctly, but it's just annoying seeing it there.

Reviews.Title: Locked
Reviews.Author: Jacques
Reviews.Content: I bought this phone and since it cost above U$D 500, did not expect to be locked .I am out the USA and can not use in any other carrier .Do not buy any Iphone for this price if it is locked, since you can get for the same price unlocked.

Reviews.Title: Perfection!
Reviews.Author: Gusboo
Reviews.Content: Wow im glad I bought my phone from this person. Phone came basically brand new! With the box, brand new iHeadphones, charger cable, charger cube, and instruction manual. No scratches whatsoever! the phone appears to be 100% new. I definetly recommend this seller to everyone! I am very happy with my purchase!-Gus =)

Reviews.Title: PERFECT
Reviews.Author: L. D.
Reviews.Content: This phone came sealed in it's original box, as advertised. It is brand new and I had it up and running as soon as I received it. It arrived sooner than I had expected. Before purchasing I had one query and the seller responded quickly. I'm totally satisfied with this purchase. Thanks.

Reviews.Title: $600 to GARBAGE
Reviews.Author: Nora
Reviews.Content: I bought this phone hoping to use it for a long time. After two month of using it got blocked. Took it to THREE repairers! None of them could unblock it, they said the phone was locked to Sprint and best thing to do is to return it to the seller. So I filed the claim through Amazon. Amazon told me its too late so just keep the product! Hey I paid $600 for the phone! $600! Throw $600 to GARBAGE! It was a good lesson. I AM NOT BUYING PHONES FROM AMAZON FROM NOW ON, IF I WANNA THROW SOME MORE MONEY AWAY, AM GONNA DO IT DIRECTLY WITHOUT OF HELP OF AMAZON

Reviews.Title: iPhone 4s~Amazing
Reviews.Author: D. Moss
Reviews.Content: I have had the iPhone 4s for almost two years now and honestly couldn't say a bad thing about it. It is very similar to the iPod touch but has more features that make it more compelling. It's the perfect for people aged 16+ because of everything that it has to offer. It makes phone calls which every phone does but at the same time this phone works better than ever phone I had in my life. It also has an app store feature which you can go on and buy several different apps. I love to have educational apps, apps for school, and games to keep myself busy when I am waiting somewhere. It also is capable of uploading and purchasing music so that you can listen to it when ever and where ever you are. I also enjoy that you can hook it up to wifi and google or web search everywhere. That is very helpful just like having a GPS built in so that you never get lost again. It also captures videos and photos great but it could have better zoom. The software updates every so often to make sure that your phone is up to date and virus free. I honestly will never have any phone but and iPhone. I can't wait to get the newest up to date version. I would think twice about buying this phone. Once you get the hang of using it you will feel the same way.

Reviews.Title: NOT IN PERFECT WORKING CONDITION
Reviews.Author: Kelsey Meyer
Reviews.Content: Volume buttons are way messed up. Cannot play audio half the time. Totally not in perfect condition, as listed. Quite disappointed.

Reviews.Title: iPhone 4s phone
Reviews.Author: Michigan guy
Reviews.Content: The iPhone 4s is a great phone for me, it's a nice weight, and isn't too large to slip into a pocket.  The photos are great for me and I am happy to have a flash for darker settings.

Reviews.Title: iPhone 4S
Reviews.Author: cobrajmr
Reviews.Content: The phone came as expected, even though I expected a charger. Even though it did not say charger was included, but the phone was nice and looked new (I bought a used one). Oh, side note, this phone is NOT unlocked so if you need it to be then that's a different story.

Reviews.Title: the best iphone even better than the Iphone 5
Reviews.Author: MekoRush
Reviews.Content: Yep i can't count how many times I've gotten a iphone 4s. ok I can, i'm on my 3rd one.  Its a great phone, very fast and snappy. No drags. Let me tell you about my lil story with the iphone 4s, i first got one back in 2011 with sprint and used it like every 5 mins lol. I was overseas so i put my overseas sim card in and used free hotspot :-) I was getting 2g speeds but it was great thanks to the iphone 4s....Since then i sold it for about $400 to try out the galaxy note, nope i somehow had to find my way back to the 4s so after trading and trading phones i ran across the 4s again. I was tricked lol into trying out the galaxy s3 and it was really nice, i dunno i just had that urge to go back to the iphone since all my notes was synced and pics was sync. so about 3 months later I just traded it back in for a iphone 4s my 3rd one. I'm probably gonna stay with the 4s for another year until more devices carry the new iphone 5 port for plug-in. androids are ok but i just feel they dont have any unique features you cant get on iphone. A big perk for me is that the iphone 4s apps are quicker, See pandora radio and youtube.

Reviews.Title: terrible
Reviews.Author: Jaylyn Niswanger
Reviews.Content: I got this phone and the entire back was cracked, i still have not recieved a replacement back and its been a couple months. And aside from that, it's also not a 4S, it's a 4.

Reviews.Title: Be Careful Who You Buy From
Reviews.Author: Daniel M
Reviews.Content: I researched the potential seller's all over Amazon's site, and finally settled on AEG WIRELESS. Their orders are fulfilled by Amazon, and after looking at reviews and seller feedback I decided they would be the best choice for what they listed as a "Brand New" and made for AT&T;'s network. When I received the phone for my mother, I took it into AT&T; with her to activate it. They took it into the back and promptly returned, telling us that their system had it listed as stolen. They said that it may have been a refurb and the seller hadn't had it removed from the blacklist. Either way, this phone either wasn't "Brand New," (I did notice some possible wear when I took it out of the box) or worse, it was stolen. The happy-ish ending is that it was fulfilled by Amazon and when I called them about it they were incredibly surprised themselves and very nice and quick to issue a refund (it was back on my account within 30 minutes). They said they'd never heard of this happening with an Amazon fulfilled order and were very apologetic. So, my advice, if you are going to order from a third party, at least make sure it is Amazon fulfilled. Thank you Amazon for making a bad situation a little better.

Reviews.Title: Nice product
Reviews.Author: Duncand57
Reviews.Content: Nice product for a great price!  If you aren't concerned about having the latest and greatest and can settle for the previous model this is the way to purchase your smart phone.  Kinda like buying a used car.  Let someone else take the big buck hit up front first!

Reviews.Title: AMAZING!
Reviews.Author: isaac
Reviews.Content: Shipped faster than expected looks brand new with not a single flaw, works completely fine as well, A MUST BUY!

Reviews.Title: Product was not new as it stated, was defective.
Reviews.Author: Jadeen Fliflet
Reviews.Content: iPhone came in on time. Looked new as stated when I ordered it for my son. Son found out 3 days later the wifi switch did not work. Would not turn off or on. Took to an apple store, ran diagnostic test. Informed us that the phone was not new and they could not fix the problem. They called it a wifi blackout.

Reviews.Title: Product was not new as it stated, was defective.
Reviews.Author: Jadeen Fliflet
Reviews.Content: iPhone came in on time. Looked new as stated when I ordered it for my son. Son found out 3 days later the wifi switch did not work. Would not turn off or on. Took to an apple store, ran diagnostic test. Informed us that the phone was not new and they could not fix the problem. They called it a wifi blackout.

Reviews.Title: Fantastic
Reviews.Author: kasey
Reviews.Content: Great phone. recommend it too. Low cost still great apple phone. couldn't be more happy with it. very very good.

Reviews.Title: iphone 4s white
Reviews.Author: nel
Reviews.Content: this iphone is rom at&t; it was in great conditions, no cracks nothing wrong with it, the phone is ready to activate and it has a sim card slot

Reviews.Title: Very happy with it
Reviews.Author: Degan
Reviews.Content: Like any apple product it works great.  I needed to get one that would work with T-mobile and this one did, awesome.

Reviews.Title: As advertised
Reviews.Author: Joseph Ross
Reviews.Content: I ordered two of these, and they came quickly and both work fine.  They were new in the box.  I have no complaints.

Reviews.Title: i was scammed by this company
Reviews.Author: betsy mandala
Reviews.Content: bought a used i phone 4 s from them--audio not working sent it back-in the meantime i needed another i phone so i purchased another used i phone 4s from them not thru amazon  after 4 wks this also broke tried many time to get a refund but got no response--so they scammed me

Reviews.Title: iphone
Reviews.Author: fred dillingham
Reviews.Content: the phone isn't very loud you can't the volume to low the battery runs down in  8hrs with out useing it.

Reviews.Title: Awesome!
Reviews.Author: Martha Hernandez
Reviews.Content: A great looking phone for being used. Written descriptions matched the actual phone upon arival.  Hard to find well taken care of used phones. So I feel lucky!!

Reviews.Title: iPhone 4s 16gb (black)
Reviews.Author: Alissa Champigny

Reviews.Title: The worst seller I've done business with Amazon
Reviews.Author: Angel Villalobos
Reviews.Content: The worst seller I've done business with Amazon , buy the phone in December 2013, received in my country in March 2014, " as new in box " by using courier delays , when I received the phone the screen did not respond , was slow, the phone to get it blocked and I had to pay to unlock the IMEI, the phone had serious problems with sensitivity. In my country I could not return it so wait until coming to Orlando, USA , a couple of days ago I went to the Apple Store to review the phone but when they to revise noted that 75 % of what parts did not comply with its policies for not being original parts from Apple , among these were front screen , rear screen , side , charger, cable, headphones and internally the phone had obviously replaced several electronic components , plus the box was also false because labels had adhesive , original boxes are printed data , such vendors should not allow him to work at Amazon.

I bought this phone and thought the phone was bad, bought a second phone and it was the same thing. I got frustrated so I had them activate my old phone and now the data on it doesn't work. It is very user friendly and intuitive. I love how I can ask it questions, dictate texts, and ask it to dial for me. I really like the navigation tool on it as well. It converts to using data on my wifi as soon as I'm in signal so I don't use a lot of data. This has been a very good phone for me! I love it!

Reviews.Title: Sold a USED phone as a NEW phone!! Fradulent???
Reviews.Author: Collette Pickett
Reviews.Content: I purchased a "NEW" Apple iPhone 4S from Andrew&Co.; What I received was a USED phone which I had to spend 8 hours with phone techs from Straight talk and Apple to get it working. I also had to pay Apple for the help since they told me this phone was bought Dec 2012 & no longer under warranty. The IMEI # on the box didn't even match the phone inside. Apple said everyone should check that. I have been told I have to pay to have it returned in order to get a refund. I didn't pay for shipping to get it here. I have asked for a $100 refund on my purchase since I do not want to have to go thru set up again. Andrew&Co; has refused to do anything to appease me. I consider this fraud.

Reviews.Title: Performance issues out weigh the positives.
Reviews.Author: Earl sturgis
Reviews.Content: First, I did not purchase this phone through Amazon, but rather, the AT&T; store.  When I first purchased the phone, I couldn't turn the phone off-which is a hassle in museums and movie theaters.  I took it into the apple store and got it replaced about six months later.  Unfortunately the  new phone wouldn't connect to wifi.  It wasn't even an option since the wifi button was grayed out.  I took it in and got it replaced-no problem.  The phone that I received has connectivity problems with the Internet as well.  It shuts off every couple of hours.  However, I haven't troubleshooted the problem on my own yet.  It's a problem because it disconnects randomly and has caused me to come close to going over the allotted data time.  I guess at this point, having an iPhone isn't as interesting as it used to be, because I think in the past I would have just put up with it.  Now, I find that I would prefer to try another phone company.

Reviews.Title: Another Wi-Fi Disaster from Apple
Reviews.Author: Music Is Everything "Music Is Everything"
Reviews.Content: The iPhone 4S is a great idea poorly executed.  Like the iPhone 4, which sparked a class-action lawsuit over its poor wi-fi antenna, the iPhone 4S is dogged by thousands of blog postings and reviews all over the internet that expose a serious problem with its wi-fi abilities.  The 4S is really a small computer, with Apple's endless offering of apps and very good voice control via Siri, but all of that causes massive data usage.  Unless you have an unlimited plan, you really need to use wi-fi as much as possible to avoid overages.  Perhaps even more important, the phone is much slower in 3G or 4G than on wi-fi, and you can't update the operating system unless the phone can access wi-fi for the massive download (unless you hook the 4S up to a computer, but then the update often fails multiple times before completing, causing hours of lost time).Despite Apple's reputation for innovative products, they also have a well-deserved reputation for ignoring these types of problems.  Despite all the blog entries in their own forums, Apple hasn't acknowledged this problem or offered any solutions (other than buying yet another phone, of course).Having used the 4S for over a year, I can say that it WAS a big step forward from my previous phone, but if I had known about the wi-fi issues, I would have bought something else.  As it stands now, I'm very unlikely to purchase another iPhone because of these persistent problems and Apple's complete lack of customer support.

Reviews.Title: Beware of this phone and Beware of replacement phones
Reviews.Author: James M. Bailey
Reviews.Content: Beware of Apple 4s phones.  We have had a lot of problems with my wife's phone and its replacement.  Read on if you like to hear of my experiences with Apple customer service.My wife purchased this phone and it worked okay until I installed a wireless system in my home.  My Galaxy III had no problems finding the network (nor any problems, I highly recommend it), nor did any of my computers.  However, her phone would not see the network.  We chatted with Apple support numerous times to no avail.  Finally, they said they would send a placement phone, a refurbished one (Beware of such phones).  Also, I had to guarantee we would return the old phone with a $450 charge to my credit card.The refurbished phone finally arrived and on the third day it would not power on.  However, when placed on a charger it would work but would not charge past 30%.  Again, after several phones calls they decided that this phone was defective.  The tech person said he would have a brand new phone sent and seem surprised that I was not excited over this.  The original phone was less than 9 months old.  However, he could not authorize this and I would have to wait another day for another person to phone to set up the delivery.This person phoned the next day and also seemed surprised that I was not delighted in the fact they would be sending me a new phone.  She explained in 4 to 5 days I would receive the new phone and would again charge my credit card until they received the old phone.  When I complained about some compensation for my trouble with their defective products she seemed surprised that anyone would ask such a thing of Apple.  She made a vague offer of some inexpensive accessory.So we are currently without a phone unless it is plugged into a charger.BTW, from my recent experience you will find all of the Apple people rather sickening in their "sweetness" and use of phases like "have a perfect day" or "that is just perfect of you".

I live more than 300 miles from the nearest Apple store but was taking a trip near one so I dropped by the Walnut Creek store in California. Once I arrived I was told that no you can't just drop by and must have an appointment. I explained that I was from out of town and that Apple support told me to just drop by, I have an open case number and won't be around for long. They refused to exchange my phone and said they could give me an appointment in a few days. My expensive Apple iPhone 4s is broken and I can not exchange it. Thanks Apple. I will make sure that I never purchase another Apple product, customer support and service is horrible. You make enough money and should repair or replace a product I paid for and is under warranty. Buy a Droid instead.

THE AT & T DEALER LOOKED UP THE SERIAL NUMBER AND IT HAD BEEN REGISTERED TO SOMEONE ELSE.  THE DATA WOULD NOT ACTIVE BECAUSE THE SERIAL NUMBER HAD ALREADY BEEN REGISTERED.  I WANT MY VISA CARD REFUNDED FOR THE FULL PURCHASE PRICE.  THIS WAS A BIRTHDAY GIFT FOR MY DAUGHTER'S SIXTEENTH BIRTHDAY!  I HAD TO GO OUT AND BUY ANOTHER PHONE JUST TO HAVE ONE TO GIVE HER.  THIS COMPANY IS CLEARLY FRADULENT.  I WILL NEVER BUY ANY ELECTRONIC ITEM FROM AMAZON AGAIN.

Reviews.Title: My first experience with apple.
Reviews.Author: Ionia Martin "Ionia"
Reviews.Content: Potatoes potaaaatoes pc's and mac's. This is the first apple product I have ever owned. There are things about this phone that I really like. I will get to those first. I like the way you can delete apps from the front screen without having to go into your settings and struggle to find what you are looking for. I think the display is pretty good and the phone itself is quite sturdy. I like the design as I don't accidentally push buttons that turn the phone on and off all the time like I have had problems with on previous phones. I like that you have so many screens and storage folders that you can access on the front screens so you don't have to spend forever looking for where you put something.All of those things are nice, but here are my problems with this phone. I hate that there is no removable media. Good luck and best wishes if you want to add music to your phone you had stored on a previous sd card. With apple it is either feast or famine. You can pay a ridiculous amount to download the music you want from Itunes or you can try as you might to use the itunes software to download the music you did not buy from the apple store. I had around two thousand songs saved onto my previous sd card from my last phone and low and behold, only about ten percent of them successfully made it over to the iphone. I hate that it is ridiculously hard to add pictures to your phone unless you downloaded them from the net or your email or took them from the actual phone camera. I miss having an sd card you can slide out and edit the contents of from your computer. The selection of ringtones that come with the phone are a joke and in order to add new ones, once again (kinda seeing a pattern here) you have to go to itunes on your pc to do so unless you want to pay for them.Often when a phone call comes in, the phone pops speaker phone on and you can't shut it off without disconnecting the call. Sometimes it will refuse to hang up the phone call you are on. occasionally I lose 3g coverage for no apparent reason and the only way to fix this is by shutting off the phone and waiting a few minutes before you turn it back on. If you leave the phone off and don't touch it, the battery will last for days, but if you use it regularly, you had better have a charger nearby. I have had this phone for about six months and wanted to wait until I felt I was used to it before leaving a review. My over all opinion is that it isn't a terrible phone, but for someone who is used to an android device, it is bound to be somewhat frustrating. I would think carefully before getting an iphone about what your needs are and if this phone can fulfill them.

Reviews.Title: Nightmare to Set-Up; Fun to Use Afterwards
Reviews.Author: Eric K.
Reviews.Content: Let me begin by saying that setting up the iPhone initially is a nightmare that can take -- literally -- days.  I can't even imagine how horrifying it would be for someone who isn't familiar with network connections, programming issues, etc.  There's this connection, that connection, linking it up to iTunes on a computer, contacting Sprint to resolve issues, contacting Sprint again to resolve more (or the same) issues.  I had better luck with reception in the 1970s with a sheet of tinfoil and a TV antenna.  I've had the phone for over a week, and I'm still contacting Sprint to resolve set-up issues.The iPhone activated in stages.  An hour after "activating" it online (and connecting it to iTunes), the phone part started to work so I could make outgoing calls.  Two hours later, the Internet kicked in.  Three hours later, texting became available.  Why it's not "plug and play" baffles my mind in today's fast-paced, instantaneous world.Then came issues with the phone calls and texts.  We finally discovered that it was because the Airave that Sprint sent us because we have poor Sprint reception at our house (in a heavily populated neighborhood) wasn't/isn't compatible with the iPhone.  It "hiccups."  Phone calls go straight to voicemail.  Texts won't send out.  Multiple same texts come in.  Over and over and over again.  After reading up online about other people's similar problems and contacting Sprint over and over again, we finally just unplugged the Airave.  It was the lesser of two evils.Another problem that arose was that when sending texts to email accounts, they showed up as picture mail, regardless of a picture being attached or not.  Several chats with Sprint later, there's still no resolution.  We've given up on that.  Similarly, when sending these "texts" to email accounts, the email address shown was a randomly generated email address based on the first person's name of the shared family plan.  That became confusing when the person sending the text wasn't the first person on the plan.  Two hours of chatting with Sprint, that was finally resolved.  (You can't manually change it online yourself for whatever reason.)The actual iPhone itself is fun to use.  The apps available are numerous, and you have to hunt and peck to find out which ones appeal most to you, download them, arrange them, and learn how to use them.The sound on voice calls isn't as good as my last non-smart Samsung phone, but I'm getting used to it.With my old phone, I could charge it every three days or so.  With the iPhone, I have to charge -- at the minimum -- nightly.  It drains energy/power faster than a half-working air conditioner in NYC in the middle of summer.  And this is just casually using it during the day, not heavily.  I also practice steps to reduce the power usage: toning down the screen brightness, closing all apps after use, etc.  I recommend getting multiple charging adapters -- for home, work, and car.  But make sure to only charge them fully when they're close to being out of power.I went with the iPhone 4S vs. the iPhone 4 mainly for Siri.  I thought that would be a great addition/concept, especially while driving.  Unfortunately, Siri has a mind of her own and only wants to work when she wants to work.  I'm constantly getting, "I'm sorry, but I cannot take requests at this time.  Please try again later."  Isn't the main purpose of asking things of Siri because you need that information RIGHT NOW?  Like directions?  Or to remind you of something later because you'll forget?  In those cases, "trying again later" isn't feasible.  My advice is to NOT get the 4S for Siri alone.  Get it for other features/reasons.  Otherwise, stick with the very similar 4 and save yourself a hundred bucks or so.Do I recommend it?  Maybe.  Once you get over the huge hurdles of set-up, it can be fun to use, and the features are nice to have at your fingertips.  I don't have any comparisons to other smartphones, though, so I can't say whether the iPhone is better than others or not.  Sometimes I wonder if it's better to go back to having one device to use as a phone (that's small and actually works) and one to use as a computer, though.

Reviews.Title: Talking about price gouging!!
Reviews.Author: Tauri33
Reviews.Content: Out of curiosity, with the upcoming release of the iPhone 5, I wanted to see what sellers were trying to sell the iPhone 4s for.  Boy was I shocked!!!  There are independent sellers on here asking anywhere between $350.00 to $625.00.  Simply outrageous!!  If you are an average consumer and don't really dig around, which these independent sellers count on and take advantage of, you'll seriously get ripped off.  With the new iPhone 5 getting ready to launch tomorrow, according to Apple, you can purchase an iPhone 4s directly from Apple (where they have lowered their prices) for only $99.  Hmmmmm.... $99 versus $350 to $625.  What a difference!!  The iPhone 4s does come in black or white and has a built in 16 GB of internal memory.  After doing a comparison look of the iPhone 5 versus the iPhone 4s on my blog ([...] even though there are very few subtle differences, both phones are virtually the same.  The iPhone 5 is slightly larger, thinner and lighter than the iPhone 4s, but only by very very negligible amounts.  And if you are considering upgrading from the iPhone 4s to an iPhone 5, keep in mind that with the new Lightning connector exclusive to the iPhone 5, it is not compatible with previous versions of the iPhone nor are the connectors on other iPhones compatible with the iPhone 5.  Though Apple does sell an adapter, it is still going to cause problems with those users who have invested a lot of money in other accessories and peripherals for their iPhone 4s's, because they're not going to be compatible with the new iPhone 5.  Though not in all cases, many people will have to go back and repurchase all new accessories and peripherals to replace the ones they had for their previous iPhone.  In my opinion, the iPhone 4s is the better deal if you absolutely HAVE to invest in an iPhone.  Not only is it cheaper ($99 through Apple, not Amazon), but it basically has just about all of the same features and functionality of the iPhone 5.  But I know there will be many people who will still overpay for their iPhones, either the 5 or the 4s, because it's not a matter of need for a lot of people, but a matter of status and bragging rights to buy into a brand so they can strut around showing off their new expensive toy.

Reviews.Title: Great Features - But very fragile
Reviews.Author: Gilbert L. Braun
Reviews.Content: I bought an iPhone 4S white three days ago (from a local Best Buy, not Amazon) to replace my wife's 3G.  My wife loved it.But, the first day, my son inadvertantly dropped it on the floor from about 2 1/2 feet height (before we had installed the case / screen protector).  And the front face shattered.  Spider cracks throughout the entire front screen.  I'd never seen a phone with so many cracks (and I've owned and dropped several iPhones with no problem).  I should say, that was until I was sitting at the Apple genius bar, before the store actually opened (open for genius bar support only) and I saw two other white phones brought in with the same problem.  HMMM ... wonder if Apple has a problem.Beware ... if you insist on buying the 4s, either buy insurance in one form or another, or immediately put the phone in a case with a screen protector.  Because Apple will not acknowledge even the possibility of a defect if the screen cracks (it's assumed it was your fault).  And the repair cost lists at $199, though some Apple stores will drop that to $149.And as much as I like Apple products (I own several), when things go wrong, they are not easy to deal with (stores full of hundreds of young, eager technicians / managers that have no authority to do anything).Perhaps I should have been more aware, given the extent of the cottage industry I have since discovered that has built up around the iPhone to repair broken iPhone screens.

Reviews.Title: Apple customer service
Reviews.Author: Quiltmaker
Reviews.Content: Apple has the WORST customer service!!! Ive had my iphone 4 months. Spent a fortune for it and for a warranty. My speakers went out yesterday. I spent two hours on the phone fighting with Apple all the way to corporate. Their options were for me was to give them a credit card number so they could put a $650 hold on my card so they could send me a different one. That way if they found I had mishandled it (which I had not),  they could run the charge through for a new one. When they tried to run the hold charge it was denied because I believe I have a limit as to the amount I can charge in one day and if I could have placed the charge on it I might not have had  enough available on my card for other purchases.  Or, according to Apple, I could call my credit card company to see if they would authorize it. My other option was to take it to UPS and have them send it to Apple and once they got it they would repair it or send a reworked one to replace my 4 month old one, but they wont send me a replacement until they receive mine. My phone was brand new 4 months ago.  I do not want a reworked or refurbished replacement.  I paid a whopping amount for my phone and a whopping amount for a warranty.  In addition, Apple badmouthed UPS by saying they didn't trust their tracking numbers (as if somehow the tracking number could be changed) and they couldn't trust them to actually put the phone in the box and ship what they were supposed too, back to Apple.  UPS was not too thrilled to hear what Apple's opinion of them was and they commented that perhaps they shouldn't even do business with them.  In the meantime,  I am without any phone now for emergencies. Worse still is the fact my 84 year old Dad is in the hospital and just had two major surgeries. He has been extremely ill and now the hospital can't reach me by phone in an emergency. SHAME ON YOU APPLE!!!!!!! Your customer service is appalling. Any other phones that I had in the past, if they had some defect, as long as they were under warranty, I was able to go into my carrier and have it replaced. Not Apple. They do NOT care about their customers or their needs. Personally,  I don't trust Apple to not send me some scrappy refurbished phone or to come back and tell me the defect was my mishandling. Think long and hard before you buy an Apple product.  I do have to say that I love the iphone.  It's a wonderful product and I'm not sorry I purchased one with my local cell phone carrier.  However, my disagreement and frustration is with Apple themselves.  Even with other Apple products, it's very difficult to get anyone to help you and they make no effort to improve their service to customers when they have difficulty with one of their products.  They simply do not care or even attempt to bend over backward to try and work with their customers or make things right with them.  Good customer service is very important.  Without it, eventually your company will suffer if you can't or won't back your product. Speaking with friends who have also had problems with their iphones, their opinion is the same as mine - dealing with Apple is a NIGHTMARE.  If you have ever had to deal with them regarding Itunes, you will know what I am talking about.  If you have never had problems with your Apple product, congratulations.  I hope you never do.  But you may find yourself in the same predicament down the road of life and in an emergency situation (what about all those emergency employees who are "on call" and end up without their phones because of Apple's poor customer service?) So you have to ask yourself, is the iphone really worth the cost....and the headache sure to follow at some point?  In the long run, you may find yourself much happier with a different smartphone.

Think long and hard before you buy an Apple product.  I do have to say that I love the iphone.  It's a wonderful product and I'm not sorry I purchased one with my local cell phone carrier.  However, my disagreement and frustration is with Apple themselves.  Even with other Apple products, it's very difficult to get anyone to help you and they make no effort to improve their service to customers when they have difficulty with one of their products.  They simply do not care or even attempt to bend over backward to try and work with their customers or make things right with them.  Good customer service is very important.  Without it, eventually your company will suffer if you can't or won't back your product. Speaking with friends who have also had problems with their iphones, their opinion is the same as mine - dealing with Apple is a NIGHTMARE.  If you have ever had to deal with them regarding Itunes, you will know what I am talking about.  If you have never had problems with your Apple product, congratulations.  I hope you never do.  But you may find yourself in the same predicament down the road of life and in an emergency situation (what about all those emergency employees who are "on call" and end up without their phones because of Apple's poor customer service?) So you have to ask yourself, is the iphone really worth the cost....and the headache sure to follow at some point?  In the long run, you may find yourself much happier with a different smartphone.
